intro: Sterculia tannaensis, commonly known as the Tanna tallow tree, is a tropical tree native to the island of Tanna in Vanuatu. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, red flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree produces a heavy, oily seed capsule that contains hard, woody seeds. It is adapted to grow in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. The plant has cultural significance to the local communities and is used for various traditional purposes.
